name: No Undead Encounters.
description: Check for encounters in the jungle with no undead. Roll three times a day.

results.text: They attack from hidden burrows. Players are surprised unless they have passive Perception of 13. The dwarves don't kill the players but want to knock them out and steal their food and gear. If the players speak dwarven or show peaceful intents they break off the attack.
Any character with passive Perception of 12 can spot them 60ft away. They run away if any character comes within 30ft. They can be trapped with an Animal Handling check of DC14.
The apes are eating fruit in a tree and look nervous. If the players back away they do not attack. In any other case they do to protect their food.

results.title: Artus Cimber
results.text: Artus and Dragonbait are encountered. They can rush in the save the characters or the characters stumbles into their camp.
Assassin vines cannot be distinguished from normal plants - even with a wisdom check. They draw carrion to them so the characters might smell that.
They charge and attack.
They can be distracted with a days worth of food, otherwise they attack.

textList.text: are hunting for food. They have blue triangles painted on their foreheads to show their devotion to Ras Nsi. If the encounter is during the day they are eating a zombie corpse. If at night they try to sneak in. Guards must pass a DC10 Perception check to not be surprised.

results.title: Chwinga
results.text: Attempts to steal something valuable from the players. It is noticed by a character with passive Perception 17 or higher. Something is left if exhange: a pretty shell, a handful of nuts or an uncut gem worth 10gp.
A cyclops is heading towards its home near Snapping Turtle Bay. It is not looking for a fight, but will if the players look hostile.
They are attracted to the party's scent and are encountered 300 ft away. A DC 15 Survival check can be used to find a safe refuge from them.
Eating plants and ignoring the party.
Will only fight in self defence, but can accidentally step on a near by player. It does not even notice them.
They chase a wild boar into the party. They decide the party is better prey and attack.
They are graving near by with $roll(1d6) young nearby. The young can be sold for 50 GP or 100 GP with DC 15 Persuasion check. The young are easily handled and separated, but the adults will fight.
They are flying at a distance and only attack if threatened.
It is a curious animal that approaches the characters. Anyone who touches it gets a swipe from its tail.
It does not attack unless the players disturb its nest. The nest contains one hatchling and two eggs. The hatchling and eggs are worth 50GP or 150GP with a Persuasion check in Port Nyanzaru.

The beast is spotted 900 ft away. There is a 50% chance it is fighting with other creatures. This may cause the T-rex to be weakened. The players can hide from it with a successful DC 15 Stealth check. If any character is proficient in Survival, all characters roll with advantage.
They are attracted to the party's scent and are encountered 300 ft away. A DC 15 Survival check can be used to find a safe refuge from them.

The dragon follows the players for a while. If they are in good spirits, it will play a few pranks on the players. After a while, if the players are not annoyed by the dragon's pranks, it agrees to answer 3 questions. It knows where Omu is and knows about the gargoyles and the snake people. It also knows about near by landmarks and points of interest.

If encountered during the day, the characters stumble into a living area iwith reed huts and stilts. The Eblis attack weak or wounded characters. However, if the players look strong they agree to trade information for gems. If given a 50GP gem they will point the players in the direction of a landmark. They may have treasure in their huts. If at night, they try to capture a player and drag them away.

textList.text: . The scouts will trade information with a non-evil party. The can be convinced to join the party for up to 3 days on a DC 12 group Persuasion check. With a Passive wisdom of 13 the players see a wooden platform that is 2d6x5 ft above the group. Players need a DC10 Althetics check to get up there. It is 10 ft square and can hold 6 characters.

results.title: Explorers
results.text: The group includes a mage, a priest, a scout and $roll(1d6) tribal warriors.
The explorers are lost and hungry.
The explorers are in good shape and are currently hunting firenewts, ghouls, goblins or grungs.
The explorers are healthy and currently heading to a nearby landmark to explore it.
The explorers are healthy and heading back to Port Nyanzaru for rest and resupply.
The players spot the slimy path of a snail. They can follow it with a successful DC10 Survival check. It's shell is worth 2,500 GP

results.title: Flaming Fists
results.text: The group consists of a knight or veteran, an acolyte, a scout and $roll(2d6) guards. They sometimes have $roll(1d4) deinonychuses who are trained to fight. They are helpful to the party if they have a charter of exploration. If they don't have one, they try to confiscate their gear and advise them to go to the fort and get a charter.

If the encounter occurs near Mbala, the monkeys are the servants of Nanny Pu'pu. Characters must pass a DC 12 Dexerity saving throw to avoid loosing a useful item. Monkeys can be grappled, captured and taught tricks.

table.name: Flying Snakes
table.description: Determine how many flying snakes are encountered.

results.text: Make a DC 13 Animal Handling check to catch one. They are worth 25gp or 50gp on DC 15 Persuasion check.
Make a DC 13 Animal Handling check to catch one. They are worth 25gp or 50gp on DC 15 Persuasion check.

table.name: Frost Giant
table.description: Determine which frost giants are encounter

results.text: Attack if players withhold information or threaten them. They are hunting Artus to get the Ring of Winter.
This is Hyalspyd's hunting party. Attack if players withhold information or threaten them. They are hunting Artus to get the Ring of Winter.
The players hear the boars. They can sneak around them with a DC12 group Stealth check.
They try to eat anything in their path. The players have advanced warning due to the noise they make.
Attack if only threatened.
Passive Perception of 11 can detect them before they attack. They jump out of burrows and attack. Any player damaged by them must pass a DC11 Con save or get Shivering Sickness.

The wasps attack immediately and surprise the characters. They ignore armoured characters and go for the unarmoured ones first. At the end of the encounter anyone damaged must pass a DC10 Constitution save or be infected with Shivering Sickness.
The players spot them quickly because they are loud and noisy. They can be avoided with a DC13 Stealth check. They have a cache and maybe treasure.

If encountered during the day the goblins set up an ambush. Passive Perception 16 can see the telltale signs of an ambush. If at night, they sneak in and attack. The guards must pass a DC16 Perception check with disadvantage. If captured the goblins can bargin for their lives by acting as guides.

If during the day, the Grungs ambush from the trees. Passive Perception of 14 required to identify the ambush. If at night, they sneak in for an attack. The guards must pass a DC14 Perception check at disadvantage. If one is catpured it will agree to lead the characters to a cache in exchange for its life.
Without warning they attack. Any player with Passive Perception of 14 is not surprised. All others are. Their skin is valuable as a magic item ingredient

The party is ambushed by the Kamadans. Any character with Passive Perception of 16 will not be surprised, all others will be. If defeated, the players can search for their lair. This requires a DC15 Survival check. If found, there is a 25% chance that  $roll(1d3) cubs are present. They can be sold for 150 GP or 300 GP with a DC15 Persuasion check.
They are hungry. They can be appeased with one day's rations per lizardfolk.

results.title: Mad Monkey Mist
results.text: There is $roll(1d6) 20ft squares of Monkey Mist. Passive Perception of 13 will be able to notice before the party stumbles into the mist. If encountered at night, the mist drifts into the camp at 5ft per minute.
They are undetectable until they attack. Each plant is 10ft apart and can only attack characters that are within 5ft. This means that generally only one can attack on the first round.
One of the Sewn Sisters from Chapter 5 is encountered. She shadows the players from the Etheral plane. During the night she takes blood or hair from one of the players.

They circle and watch the characters carefully. They only attack during the next encounter trying to pick off wounded players with their javelins. If they meet strong resistance they leave but might regroup and return.

results.title: Rare Plant
results.text: $roll(2d6) Monkey Fruit growing on a tree.

results.title: Rare Plant
results.text: Menga bush with $roll(2d6) ounces of leaves.

results.title: Rare Plant
results.text: $roll(1d4) Ryath Roots growing in the ground.

results.title: Rare Plant
results.text: $roll(4d6) Sinda Berries growing in a bush.

results.title: Rare Plant
results.text: Wukka tree with $roll(2d6) Wukka nuts.

results.title: Rare Plant
results.text: $roll(1d6) Zabou growing on a dead tree.

textList.text: They all answer to Valindra Shadowmantle in the Heart of Ubtao. If this occurs outside Omu, these reinforcements are on the way to the city. If it occurs in the city, they are searching for the shrines. They are not interested in fighting and can prove a crude map if they players threaten them.

results.text: The snake attacks a random person. They are surprised unless they have Passive Wisdom greater than 12.
The snake attacks a random person. They are surprised unless they have Passive Wisdom greater than 12.
The snake attacks a random person. They are surprised unless they have Passive Wisdom greater than 14.

A character with Passive Wisdom of 13 can spot webs in the trees and alert the party. Otherwise the lead character stumbles into a web and is grappled unless they make a DC12 Athletics check. The web has hundreds of harmless baby spiders.

results.title: Status of Ubtao
results.text: A character with Passive Wisdom of 12 notices it. The statue depicts a stylized Chultan King - Ubtao.
Goblin, grung and su-monster skulls are piled around the base of the statue.

A glyph of wardening is on the statue. A character must pass a DC15 Investigation check to find it. Any character touching the statue causes the glyph to explode. The blast is 20ft radius and causes 5d8 damage but characters can pass a DC14 Dex save to take half. If triggered, there is a 75% that a nearby troll or stirges will come and investigate.

The statue has grooves carved into its stomach which forms a maze. Any character studying this can find the path with a DC10 Intelligence check. If they do this, they are bestowed with a Find the Path spell as an action that they can cast at will. The statue resets each dawn.
If during the day, the players stumble into their nest. If at night they descend on the camp and attack.
They approach looking dangerous, but try to get close enough to use their psychic crush. If things go bad they flee into the trees. If the players search the trees they may find treasure.
They attack immediately.
They attack immediately. At the end of the encounter any character damaged by them must pass a DC11 Con save or get Shivering Sickness.
Passive Perception 15 to notice them. They watch the party from 300 ft. Shadows the party and may help them.

results.title: Tiger
results.text: The tiger can only be detected with a Passive Perception of 16. It pounces on a character from 40ft. If it looses half its hit points it retreats.
They cannot be distinguished from normal plants. They encounter is during the day the characters stumble into them. If at night, they try to use their spores to put them to sleep first.
Each is mounted on a Thorny. They flee if outnumbered but otherwise attack.

Masquerades as a Chultan priest. Wears a maze like Ubtao holy symbol around its neck. It demands that the party turn back. It is guarding a Statue of Ubtao, a grove of Wukka trees or its lair. Its lair has treasure.
Offers to guide the party through the wilderness. Will stay for 24 hours. During this time they will have no hostile encounters.

results.title: Winterscape
results.text: A 120ft ring of frozen ground caused by Artus while fighting in the past.
If during the day, they players stumble into the zombies. The creeper is at the center. If at night, the zombies try to drag the players to the nearby creeper.

This encounter happens if the players are more than 25 miles from Omu. They are trying to gathering information for Ras Nsi. They stay away from the players, but a succcessful DC 13 Perseption check might spot them while they withdraw.

This encounter happens if the players are within 25 miles of Omu. They are trying to gathering information for Ras Nsi. They stay away from the players, but a succcessful DC 14 Perseption check might spot them while they withdraw. If pursued they transform into snakes and escape.
If Artus is not with the players they are ignored. If Artus is with them, they demand the ring and attack if not given it.
If encountered during the day, they are traveling and show aggression to the players but only attack if threatened. If encountered during the night they are hungry and attack.
